text: [Music]
hello
i am shulpi a cloud support engineer
here at the aws office in dublin
today i'm going to show you the reasons
why sometimes a workspace in aws
workspaces
gets stuck in the starting rebooting or
stopping state
and what can we do to fix the issue
let's get started
the workspace status is determined by
the health checks of the workspace
components such as pcorip standard agent
skylight workspaces conflict service or
web access agent
sometimes the workspaces operating
system can take a long time to boot
or these components can fail to report
the actual status of the workspace and
time
this can happen due to any pending
windows updates
workspace services in stopped state or
disabled network adapters these issues
can cause the workspace to be stuck in
starting
rebooting or stopping state if the
workspace is still stuck after waiting
for few minutes
check the status of these components at
the os level
to check the same connect to your
workspace with an rdp connection
in the rdp session of the workspace open
start menu button
and scroll down to windows
administrative tools
expand windows administrative tools and
scroll down to open services
here verify the running state of the
core workspace services
and start them if they are stopped the
status for all these services
should be running and startup type set
as automatic
the services we need to check are pc
over ip standard agent for windows
skylight workspace config service
sdx hd hosted application service
to start the service or change the
startup type
if not set to automatic right click its
name
and choose properties to change the
startup type
navigate to the drop down menu and
select automatic
now choose start and then apply followed
by
ok
when we are sure that the core workspace
services are running
but we see that the issues still persist
we will check to make sure that the
network adapters are enabled
to do this open start menu and navigate
to control panel to open it
on this page choose network and internet
and then select the option network and
sharing center
by default all workspaces have two
network adapters configured
that are required for its functioning on
this page
verify that there are two network
adapters listed in the view your active
network section
if there is only one network listed then
choose change adapter settings
from the left hand panel confirm that
both ethernet adapters are in enable
state
if you notice any one of them to be in
disabled state
right click the disabled ethernet
adapter and then choose
enable
if you still experience the issue
restart the workspace from the aws
management console
wait a few minutes for the workspace to
come online and then try again to
connect to the workspace
the status of the workspace will change
within 90 minutes
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us
here at aws
